correction_response:
This tweet is misinformed. Andrew Tate's arrest was not due to a pizza box in a video or Greta Thunberg's involvement. Romanian law enforcement had been investigating the case since April 2022, and the theory that Tate was detained thanks to the information seen on a couple of pizza boxes in the video is incorrect. Thunberg's comment about recycling pizza boxes was a quip following online speculation. 
https://leadstories.com/hoax-alert/2022/12/fact-check-andrew-tates-arrest-not-because-of-pizza-boxes-in-video-with-name-phone-number.html
https://www.reuters.com/world/romania-detains-ex-kickboxer-andrew-tate-human-trafficking-case-2022-12-30/
note_1_text: According to the Romanian prosecutor’s office, the pizza box in Andrew Tate’s video didn’t lead to his detention.    It took months to investigate and build a case before they arrested him.    https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/2022/12/30/andrew-tate-detained-romania-brothers-crime
note_2_text: “Speculation online centered on whether a distinctive pizza box … had helped lead the authorities to him, but Ramona Bolla, a spokeswoman for the Directorate for the Investigation of Organized Crime and Terrorism, told The New York Times … that that was not the case.”    https://www.nytimes.com/2022/12/30/world/europe/andrew-tate-romania-arrest.html

refute_evidences: - In a phone interview with Lead Stories staffer Ioana Burtea on December 30, 2022, Bolla said Romanian law enforcement had been investigating the case since April 2022, when Tate and his brother Tristan were questioned about holding two young women hostages in their Ilfov County residence. Reference: https://leadstories.com/hoax-alert/2022/12/fact-check-andrew-tates-arrest-not-because-of-pizza-boxes-in-video-with-name-phone-number.html published on 2022-12-30 10:07:51

- Did the appearance of a name and number on pizza boxes delivered to former professional kickboxer Andrew Tate in a video he posted lead to his arrest by Romanian authorities on December 29, 2022? No, that's not true: Ramona Bolla, a spokeswoman for the country's Directorate for Investigating Organized Crime and Terrorism (DIICOT), said in a phone interview with Lead Stories that the theory Tate was detained thanks to the information seen on a couple of pizza boxes in the video is "funny, but has nothing to do with what actually happened. Reference: https://leadstories.com/hoax-alert/2022/12/fact-check-andrew-tates-arrest-not-because-of-pizza-boxes-in-video-with-name-phone-number.html published on 2022-12-30 10:07:51

- Following online speculation that the brand of pizza featured in the video helped police confirm Tate's presence in Romania, Thunberg quipped on Twitter that "this is what happens when you don't recycle your pizza boxes". Reference: https://www.reuters.com/world/romania-detains-ex-kickboxer-andrew-tate-human-trafficking-case-2022-12-30/ published on 2022-12-30 00:00:06

- However, the anti-organised crime unit representative said it was not the case that Tate's arrest had been made as a result of the pizza boxes. Reference: https://www.reuters.com/world/romania-detains-ex-kickboxer-andrew-tate-human-trafficking-case-2022-12-30/ published on 2022-12-30 00:00:06
